title: Defining Absolute Maximum
text: The absolute maximum of f at $$x=c$$ is f(c) where $$f(c) \geq f(x)$$ for all $$x$$ in the domain of f.
speech: The absolute maximum of f at  x is equal to c  is f(c) where  f of c is greater than or equal to, f of x  for all  x  in the domain of f.
pacedSpeech: The absolute maximum of f at   x is equal to c
is f(c) where   f of c is greater than or equal to, f of x

title: Absolute Maximum
text: The graph attains an absolute maximum in two locations, $$x=-2$$ and $$x=2$$, because at these locations, the graph attains its highest point on the domain of the function.
speech: The graph attains an absolute maximum in two locations,  x is equal to, negative 2  and  x, is equal to 2 , because at these locations, the graph attains its highest point on the domain of the function.
pacedSpeech: The graph attains an absolute maximum in two locations,   x is equal to, negative 2
, because at these locations, the graph attains its highest point on the domain of the function.

title: Absolute Maximum
text: What is the corresponding y-value at $$x=-2$$ and $$x=2$$?
